intro: Eremophila interstans subsp. virgata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf emu bush, is a shrub native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red, typically blooming in winter and spring. It is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
